```{r load corpus}
l_star_h_types = c("^[L*]H", "L*H", "L*^[H]", "^[L*H]")

# Load Corpus
m_corpus <- get_m_corpus("../data/m_corpus.csv")  %>%
  # Select only columns for analysis
  select(
    speaker,
    gender,
    mode,
    prompt,
    acc_phon,
    fin_phon,
    lh_slope) %>% 
  filter(acc_phon %in% l_star_h_types)  %>% 
  mutate(acc_phon = factor(acc_phon,
                           levels = l_star_h_types)
         )
```

- Maximal model works well.
- Slightly leptokurtic, but not worth trimming.

#### `lh_slope ~  mode + (1 + mode | speaker) + (1 | gender) + (1 | fin_phon) + (1 | prompt)`

```{r run initial model,  fig.height=3, fig.width=9, tidy = TRUE}

# run model
lh_slope_model <-
    lmer(
        lh_slope ~
         mode + (1 + mode | speaker) + (1 | gender) + (1 | fin_phon) + (1 | prompt),
        data = m_corpus,
        control = lmerControl(
            optimizer = "optimx",
            calc.derivs = FALSE,
            optCtrl = list(
                method = "nlminb",
                starttests = FALSE,
                kkt = FALSE
            )
        )
      )

summariseLME(lh_slope_model, run_step=TRUE,
              write="../output_model_anovas/Mode_lh_slope_anova.csv")

```


```{r make tidy model, fig.height=2.5, fig.width=5, results="asis"}

lh_slope_model.tidy <- analyseModel(lh_slope_model,
                                write="../output/Mode_lh_slope"
                                )
lh_slope_model.tidy$table

```

```{r do pairwise analysis, tidy = TRUE}

charts <- getModelFixedFX(
  my_equation =
    lh_slope ~ 
     mode + (1 + mode | speaker) + (1 | gender) + (1 | fin_phon) + (1 | prompt),
  my_data = m_corpus,
  write="../output/Mode_lh_slope"
)
charts$slopes


```
